title: 'We can't afford to keep giving NHS discounts'
description: Some business owners said they have been asked up to 100 times for deductions on food bills by NHS staff over the lockdown.

title: Tokyo 2020: ‘Delaying the Olympics changed our careers’
description: For some, it means competing when they couldn’t before. For others, it’s a year too long to wait.

title: Boris Johnson: After one year in power, how is the PM doing?
description: Boris Johnson has been in power for a year, is he delivering on the goals set out in his first speech?

title: Did Sweden's coronavirus strategy succeed or fail?
description: Despite global criticism, Sweden has seen a drop in serious Covid cases without ever having a lockdown.

title: Rap duo 4 Wheel City and the Krip-Hop career they never expected
description: Namel and Ricardo were paralysed in shootings, now as rap duo 4 Wheel City they talk about the 'double drama' of being black and disabled.

title: Nasa Mars rover: How Perseverance will hunt for signs of past life
description: If there was life on Mars, how will the US space agency's next robot rover recognise it?

title: IS prisoner issue a ticking timebomb for the West
description: Unfinished business of foreign fighters presents a renewed security problem in the world.

title: Quiz of the week: Which Joaquin Phoenix film had a role in a hostage drama?
description: How closely have you been paying attention to what's been going on during the past seven days?

title: Caitlin Moran adapts her book How To Build A Girl for big screen
description: Actress Beanie Feldstein has read all her books and now she is playing "a version" of author Caitlin Moran in How To Build A Girl.

title: 'They said I'd be cleaning toilets so I quit'
description: Retail staff returning to work are being asked to take on new duties - and they have mixed feelings about it.

title: Tokyo Olympics: Coronavirus risk raises questions over 2021 Games
description: The Olympics are now one year away - again - but some athletes fear that they won't happen at all.

title: Legacy of Kenyan clan 'branded evil' by colonialists
description: The BBC’s Anne Soy travelled to her birthplace to meet clan members in her Kalenjin ethnic community.

title: Coronavirus: Will lockdown easing see more of us using rivers?
description: There has been a surge in people visiting waterways after the lockdown was eased, outdoor groups say.

title: Coronavirus: Has Covid-19 exposed UK's underlying ill health?
description: What lessons has coronavirus taught us - and will ministers and health leaders act upon them?

title: Coronavirus: The circus preparing to reopen after lockdown
description: Britain's last remaining permanent circus venue is preparing to reopen.

title: Reopening US schools 'makes our kids guinea pigs'
description: Florida's decision to reopen all brick and mortar schools in August caused a teacher backlash.

title: Brexit: Trade deal some way off, say UK and EU
description: But UK and EU negotiators say they believe an agreement is still possible before December's deadline.

title: Archer back in England squad for final Test
description: Pace bowler Jofra Archer is included in the England squad for the deciding Test against West Indies.

title: Coronavirus: Boris Johnson says response shows 'might of UK union'
description: Boris Johnson visits Scotland as the SNP says he is worried about support for independence.

title: Coronavirus: Walk-in centres 'to help cope with winter'
description: Officials are worried people are still not coming forward for testing when they are infected.

title: England v West Indies: Watch the best of Ben Stokes' second Test display
description: Watch highlights of Ben Stokes' impressive all-round performance, which helped England square the series against West Indies with victory in the second Test.

title: US protests: Is it legal to send in federal forces?
description: President Trump is sending federal agents to some US cities to tackle crime, despite local officials disputing his power to do that.

title: Hackers saw 36 Twitter accounts' private messages
description: One of those affected was Dutch far-right politician Geert Wilders, who called it "unacceptable".

title: Liverpool: Nine arrests as fans gather at Anfield
description: Thousands of fans gathered as Sir Kenny Dalglish presented the Premier League trophy.

title: Mercury Prize 2020: Female artists lead nominations for the first time
description: Female artists and female-fronted bands outnumber men on the shortlist for the first time ever.

title: Germany's Ritter Sport wins square chocolate battle against Milka
description: Swiss chocolate-maker Milka challenged the German bar's right to be the only square bar in Germany.

title: Guitar sales rise as UK gets into lockdown groove
description: As more people learn guitar amid lockdown, the UK's biggest online seller of instruments sees sales surge.

title: Coronavirus: Ministers urged to end face coverings 'confusion'
description: The government has been accused of mixed messages over whether the masks should be worn in takeaways.

title: Coronavirus: Will people be rushing back to the gym?
description: Indoor gyms reopen in England on Saturday - but with the rise of home workouts will people return?

title: Coronavirus: App to show beachgoers crowd levels
description: The phone app shows which beaches are crowded along 15 miles of coastline.

title: Britain's Greatest Olympic Moments: Nicola Adams wins boxing gold at London 2012
description: BBC Sport looks back at Nicola Adams' gold medal at London 2012 as she became the first women's boxing champion in Olympic history.

title: The Papers: 'Winter quadruple whammy' and 'we won't shop you'
description: Thursday's papers say No 10 has ordered the Army to prepare for four consecutive emergencies this winter.

title: Anthony Walker: How a life lost in racist killing has been imagined for TV
description: A TV drama imagines the future life of Anthony Walker, who was killed in a racist attack in 2005.
